templates.name: Height/weight limit for Travel Crib
templates.content:
The Newton Travel Crib & Play Yard is designed to grow with your child from infancy through toddler years. As with any children's product, your little one's milestones will be the best indicator to determine when it is time to transition out of the product.

The Travel Crib & Play Yard Bassinet Insert is designed for newborns and infants up to about five months or roughly 15 pounds. Once your little one begins to push up on hands and knees, or can roll over, it is time to transition from the Bassinet insert to the main Travel Crib. The Travel Crib & Play Yard is designed to be used from infancy through the toddler years. Once your toddler is able to use the side rails to pull themselves up off the floor in an attempt to climb out, the Play Yard should no longer be used.

templates.name: Difference between the toddler and infant side of the waterproof pad/cover?  (simplified version)
templates.content: The infant side is more breathable while also stopping any bed-wetting from leaking all the way down to the floor of your nursery. When an accident happens, simply remove and wash the cover and spray down the core. Then once your child can pull to stand on their own and breathability isn't as important, put the waterproof surface on the top to stop messes from getting into the core. Of course you can always clean the core, but this will save you some time.

templates.name: Does your waterproof mattress make a lot of noise?
templates.content: Our approach to waterproofing is unique, as we don't place the waterproof liner on top of the mattress, but actually quilt it into the bottom layer of the cover, under 2 layers of highly breathable spacer material. This allows for a channel of air between your baby and the waterproof layer, and less chances of noise keeping your baby awake. The biggest risk for suffocation during child development is during the first 12 months. Though the waterproof side is still breathable, we want infants to have the most breathable, completely unhindered airflow sleeping environment possible for the first year, which is why we recommend waiting until year 1 to use the waterproof side, however, you know your child's development and mobility best. While we understand Waterproofing seems most desirable to help with messes, the infant side of the cover is water-resistant and when babies leak or *explode* in the first year of life, these accidents are easily managed by washing the cover and most times even rinsing the core.

templates.name: Does the mini fit in a pack n' play?
templates.content: The Mini Crib Mattress is meant for a rigid-sided mini crib only. It's not recommended that you put a supplemental mattress into a pack n' play for safety reasons. Use only the pad and mattress provided by the manufacturer in play-yards, as they are meant to fit securely in the product. Because pack n' plays or play-yards are soft-sided, placing a supplemental mattress inside of one can cause a gap and safety hazard for your little one. The great news is that Newton makes a Travel Crib & Play Yard with a breathable mattress that Newton is known for!

templates.name: Will your mattress still work if my measurements are different/or close to yours?
templates.content: Our mattress is made to fit all standard American-sized cribs. The material of our mattress core is more pliable than those used in most standard mattresses and therefore will have some give to be able to fit snugly into the crib and not be a safety hazard. When checking that our mattress will fit in your crib, be sure that you're using the measurement of the inside of the crib, not that of the outside edge to outside edge.

templates.name: Is a sheet recommended? Difference between using the waterproof mattress vs the regular one with a waterproof cover/pad?
templates.content: The cover for the Original mattress isn't waterproof but it is water resistant. Most messes won't go through to the core, allowing you to easily switch the cover during a late night change and get your little one back to sleep. It has the same breathe-thru materials on both sides making it easy to flip or switch as needed. When you're ready to add waterproof protection during toddler and potty training stages, the mattress pad easily fits on it like a fitted sheet giving breathable, waterproof protection. The pad is also a great item to have when traveling or for a childcare setting, as it can give a layer of breathability to traditional crib mattresses. Our Waterproof mattress has an underlining of waterproofing on one side of the cover for toddler years and the same breathe-thru material of the Original on the infant side. Of course, you can use a sheet! Make sure it's a breathable muslin cotton sheet that doesn't hinder the mattress' airflow. We make the softest, most breathable sheets that fit perfectly around your crib mattress, and you can find them here - https://newton.attn.tv/sl/ttfkGkLf

templates.name: Difference between the original and waterproof mattress core?

templates.name: Can the Newton mattress be used from infancy through toddler years?
templates.content: Yes, our mattress is designed to grow with your child from infancy through toddler years. It's designed to offer the firmness and support your infant needs for bone growth and development, yet it's comfortable enough for your toddler. Once your baby reaches toddler years, consider adding the waterproof mattress pad to help battle those bigger late night messes without losing the breathability and comfort that they love.

templates.name: Differences between your 3 mattresses? (Essential, Original, and Waterproof Crib Mattress)
templates.content:
Our crib mattresses come in three versions. Our patented Wovenaire core is in all of our mattresses and it's made up of 90% air by volume and 10% food-grade polymer, Wovenaire is, well, just that - woven-air. The difference in the mattresses comes down to what type of cover is best for your family. The 3 mattress options are the Essential, Original, and Waterproof Crib Mattress. 

The Essential is a slimmer profile at only 4" thick instead of 5.5" that you find in the Original and Waterproof versions. The covers vary in each type of mattress, so the Essential one has a thinner single layer of spacer material that covers the Wovenaire core, the Original, however, is made with 2-layers of thick spacer material that is quilted together to create soft pillows of air over the fully breathable Wovenaire core, and our Waterproof Mattress uses the same construction in the cover as our Original one, plus a layer of breathable waterproof lining added to one side of the cover. This toddler side helps combat bigger messes as your baby grows and potty training begins! Each mattress cover fully zips off, and the entire mattress is washable from cover to the core. The Essential is a bit firmer in feel, as the cover isn't as thick or quilted as the other 2 which are 2-stage mattresses: firm enough for babies, and comfortable to grow with them all through toddler years.

templates.name: Can I lay with my child at night (kids' mattress)?
templates.content: Our mattress is suitable for infancy through toddler years and has been tested up to 100 lbs and will easily transition with your toddler. Things like getting in for story time and comforting at night will be just fine, but keep in mind it is a Kid's Mattress and intended for use for your growing little ones.

templates.name: What are your sheets and swaddles made of?
templates.content: Our sheets are made from 100% Organic Cotton Muslin for maximum breathability and comfort. Super soft from the first touch, our sheets and swaddles are GOTS certified and are designed to be as breathable as our mattress.

templates.name: Are the pet beds orthopedic for older dogs or joint problems?
templates.content: Yes! Our orthopedic pet bed is designed to ease joints and cushion pressure points for a better, more restful and super comfortable sleep.

templates.name: Do I need a pad for the Kids' Mattress?
templates.content: The Kids' Mattress is not waterproof. The cover material is water-resistant, and we recommend adding the Twin Waterproof Mattress Pad to the Kids' Mattress as needed for potty training and accident protection. The pad will also add an additional layer of cushion to the mattress while making cleaning and getting your child back to bed that much easier.

templates.name: Can I wash the pet bed?
templates.content: Absolutely! The fully removable cover and polyester-filled washable bolsters can be tossed into the washing machine, and the Wovenaire core can be taken into the shower or hosed off outside.

templates.name: How long will the pet bed last?
templates.content: Our dog beds are designed to be slept in and will last for years, with regular wear and tear. The lifespan of a pet bed depends partly on the age, character, and sleeping habits of your dog.

templates.name: What is Wovenaire?
templates.content: Wovenaire is a patented cushioning material that replaces foam, latex, and springs and it's the core of all our mattresses. It's made of 100% recyclable food-grade polymer, an LDPE grade 4 plastic. It's the same material as a yogurt container! Wovenaire is 90% air by volume - which makes it incredibly light and, well, airy. In addition, Wovenairee is made with hypoallergenic materials, and it is the most hygienic sleeping surface for your little one because it's completely washable. It's Greenguard Gold Certified, which means it is tested and certified to have the lowest chemical emissions possible.

templates.name: Is the Kids' Mattress comfortable for my child?
templates.content: Our Kids' mattress is made with the same technology, comfort, and firm support Newton is known for in our crib mattresses. The Kids' Mattress offers the support your growing toddler needs as they transition from their crib to their big-kid bed. It's designed for toddlers 100lbs and under. Many parents tell us their little ones start sleeping better from the first night, and we couldn't be happier.

templates.name: What’s the mattress made of?
templates.content: Unlike foam and latex, our mattresses are completely safe, non-toxic, hypoallergenic, and breathable. Our mattresses consist of 3 components: the Wovenaire unique core material made of 90% air and 10% food-grade polymer (that's the stuff yogurt containers are made from), the 3-dimensional Breathe-Thru cover that is 100% polyester, and an encasement made of viscose (a reconstituted wood pulp) that is used as a natural fire barrier. Our Waterproof Mattress and Waterproof Crib Mattress Pad have a TPU lining that is a heat-sealed fabric waterproof lining. Additionally, all of our mattresses are Greenguard Gold certified, showing our products are safe and non-toxic and will help improve indoor air quality.

templates.name: How often should I wash my mattress?
templates.content: You can wash your crib mattress as often as needed. Spot clean, or give it a full wash whenever you like! The cover can be laundered as much as you desire, or as often as you would launder your fitted sheet. Make sure to check our care and use instructions for the best practices on how to care for your mattress here: https://www.newtonbaby.com/pages/assembly-care

Having a Newton Crib Mattress in your crib will ease your baby into their crib setting, as the comfort and breathability they have become used to in the bassinet will be present in their new sleep space as well.

templates.name: How do I assemble the Kids’ Mattress?
templates.content:
Before attempting to assemble your kids' mattress, please note that the cover and core will arrive in 2 separate boxes. Ensure receipt of both boxes and follow the steps below:

1. Unroll cover (arrives unzipped as top and bottom layers) and set top cover aside
2. Lift side walls of bottom cover into a box shape
3. Fit all 3 core segments inside, making certain that all edges (especially the top edges) align flush against each other (no bumps or spaces in between)
4. Place top cover over assembled bottom cover and core
5. Zip closed, tucking front flap in between core and side walls

Hope this helps and please let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with.

templates.name: Travel Crib & Play Yard pad fit
templates.content:
To ensure the sleeping pad is properly installed, please be sure that the following assembly tips are followed:

- All 4 legs are locked into place. You should hear a soft snap or click as the locking mechanism of each leg engages
- Attach all four rubber feet to the bottom of each leg
- Place the custom sheet on the pad.
- Ensure that all fabric on the Travel Crib legs is pulled down into correct position and not bunched up or pulled up on leg (as this will pull up the corners of the base)

The Newton Travel Crib and Play Yard is anything but traditional, and you can expect some details to be different than you might be used to with other travel cribs. Because the sleeping pad is not attached to a rigid base, you may not see the same type of fit that you might see with a traditional travel crib. With Newton, every component has been designed and constructed to be as breathable as possible. From the sheet, through the sleeping pad and cover, all the way to the side walls of the travel crib itself - all of these fabrics are fully breathe-thru. This means that if there is an unintended bump in the fabric, you can rest easy knowing that there is no safety concern with the fully breathable mattress in the Newton Travel Crib.
